lines.text: [last lines]

[Allie narrating]
I cried the whole week of Sam's funeral. Graham says that won't bring him back. He says I have to start letting go. He's right. Hedy's parents said that for years they tried to explain to her that her sister's death wasn't her fault but she never forgave herself for surviving. So, every day, I try to forgive Hedy for Sam. Then I try to do what she couldn't - Forgive myself. I know what can happen to someone who doesn't.
[Hedy tells Allie the cops are on their way and that Allie needs to go with her]

[Hedy slaps her hands together]
Okay. Come on. The police will be here soon.
But... But you shouldn't run. It'll only make it worse. I know you weren't yourself when you did this, Hedy.

[Hedy chuckles]
I know. I was you. Who is this Hedy, anyway? No one's seen her. She's not on the lease. There's not even a fingerprint of hers here. I've been cleaning like crazy. You have to come with me, Allie, or they'll put you away.
[Graham warns Allie to get rid of Hedy out of her apartment]
Allie, either she's gone by Saturday or I go to the police, okay?

[Allie smiles]
That was pretty impressive.
I can be butch when I have to. I get it from my mother.
[Allie tries to tell Hedy that she will need to move out]
You've been a good roommate. But it's just this is the man I's going to marry. I want us to start our lives together.

[Hedy sighs]
Well, he will cheat on you again. That's a promise. And when he does, don't come running to me, okay? Because I've had it with you. You're so fucking weak!

[Allie pauses as Hedy smiles back]
I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.
[Hedy tells Allie what it's really like to be an identical twin]

[Hedy softly tells Allie]
Did you know that identical twins are never really identical. There's always one who's prettier. And the one who's not does all the work. She used me, and... Then she left me. Just like you.

[Hedy holds a gun up to Allie's head while holding a handful of pills]
Come on. Take them. Come on, Allie, it's nicer this way.
[Hedy tries to find Allie down in the basement hallways]

[Hedy grabs a hold of a hook for a weapon]
Don't make me come get you! Allie? Come out now. Come on. Allie. Allie!

[Hedy begins slamming the hook into a pipe, screaming louder for Allie to come out]
Come on. Come out now! Allie, please!

[Hedy starts to cry in a little girls' voice]
I'm scared. Where are you?
[as Allie drops a rat from the ventilation shaft into Hedy's chest]
[Allie attempts to escape from Graham's apartment as she breaks a glass over Hedy's head]

[Hedy holds her gun on Allie from escaping]
Allie! Please... Please!
I'm not your sister, Hedy. Not anymore. I'm like you now.
[first lines]

[Sam talks to Allie while laying in bed]
So how many kids do we want?
I don't know. What's the statistical norm?
Oh... You and your statistics. One point two.
Hm... Okay, then I want two point two. And I want them to look like you.
Oh, those poor kids.
[Allie talks to Graham about not wanting to live alone]
It's just - Living alone, you know? And the thought of buying those books like Cooking For One and... It's just too depressing.
There are worse things than being on your own, you know?
Maybe it's all a sign I should go home.
Come on. You came here for a reason. Sam has nothing to do with that. No guy does. You think I'd let some guy interfere with my acting career? Assuming I had a career, or a guy to interfere with it.
You'll find someone again.
Maybe I will - Why not? But the point is, if I don't... I don't.
I know that. I can do it on my own.
Absolutely.
I'll just get a roommate.
[Allie shows the Talkative Applicant the apartment]

I'm an incest survivor, you know? I haven't remembered the incident yet but I know it's there somewhere. I just have to sense that I survived something. All my therapists think so. Oh, God, a kitchen. I hate kitchens - Cooking, cleaning, anything feminine! It's my mother's fault.
[Allie quickly and quietly crosses the girl's name off from her applicant list]
[Allie reads Hedy's name for the first time in her application]
'Hedra.' That's unusual.

[Hedy blushes]
I got terrible nicknames growing up, which I'm not telling you.
Not Hedy, like Hedy Lamarr? I mean, that's exotic.
Well, I wasn't that exotic in grade school - As opposed to now, right?
[Hedy comments on the way Allie is dressed as the two of them walk down the street]

[Hedy chuckles]
Where'd you guys learn to dress like that? I mean, it's just so New York.
I think you look very comfortable.
Yeah, I never know what looks good.
[Allie sneaks into Hedy's room, trying on some of her lotion and holding her earrings to her ears, as Hedy startles Allie from behind]

[Allie scoffs]
God - I didn't know you were home. I was, um...

[Hedy covers a private box of hers on the bed with her towel]
I was, um... God, I'm sorry. You haven't even been here two weeks, and I'm already in your room.

[Allie jokes]
I was just about to go through your drawers.
[Allie asks Hedy if she comes from a big family]
Um... I, um... Well, I was supposed to be a twin, but... She was stillborn.
Oh, that's so sad.
I grew up feeling a part of me was missing, you know?
[Graham talks to Allie on the street about her new roommate Hedy]
Ready to kill her yet?
Who? Hedy?
Mm-hmm.
No, no. It's kind of fun having a girlfriend again.
I can tell. I was worried for a while there, you were so down. You were starting to look like a Kennedy wife.
[Hedy confronts Allie about not coming home or calling]

[Hedy in a low voice mumbles from Allie's bed]
Where the hell have you been?

[Hedy turns on the bedroom lamp]
God. Hedy, what are you doing in my room?
00 last night to hear from you. I've been worried sick. Buddy was crying all night. I finally had to come in here so he'd calm down.
I'm sorry, I guess I just didn't think.
No, you didn't. And there's such a thing as a phone, you know? This is New York - Things happen.
Okay, okay. I'm sorry, it was... thoughtless, really.

[Allie tries to smile]
You're making me feel like I'm 16 years old here.
[Allie tries to tell Hedy that she'll be happy and she'll find somebody after she moves out]
You'll be very happy and I'll be alone.
No, no, wait a minute - You'll find someone, Hedy. I mean, God, if I can...

[Hedy scoffs]
Why don't you look in the mirror, huh?

[Hedy walks Allie to the mirror as they both look at each other]
Look. You're in a different league. I know that. You have this great personality. You've got this great style. You run your own business... You're always going to find someone. You have to be stupid to think that you wouldn't.
[Mitch attempts to rape Allie during a late night business dinner]

[Mitch stands behind Allie in her chair]
What are you doing?

[Mitch runs his hands over Allie's shoulders]
It's just that you're so tight.
Mitch, please, don't. That's enough.

[Mitch wraps his arm around Allie to hold her down]
Mitch!
Now, look. Come on.

[Mitch starts to kiss Allie's neck]
I've been a good boy, haven't I? You've been a good girl, and we have nothing to prove anymore.

[Mitch slides and squeezes his hand down into Allie's shirt]
This is your last chance to play before you're an old married lady.

[Allie frighteningly whispers to Mitch]
Let me turn around, okay?

[Mitch let's go of Allie, beginning to pull down his pants]
That's better. That's better. Just a second. Just a sec.
[Allie in the chair turns to face Mitch, hitting him in the private area before running out of his place of business]
[Hedy makes a threatening call to Mitch Myerson, pretending to be Allie on the phone]

[Hedy in a low voice]
Listen, you pathetic shit. You want to hold on to your business? No, you listen to me this time, asshole. If you trash me around town, you're fucked. And your family is fucked too, you got that? It won't just be you.

[Hedy hangs up the phone with a big smile giving a bow to Allie]
Ta-da! Let me tell you he is pissing in his PJ's right now.
Gee, Hedy, I hope you never get mad at me.
[Allie see's Hedy walking down the stairs of the hair salon with Allie's same exact styled haircut and hair color]

[to herself softly]
You've got to be kidding.
[Hedy looks at her new Allie haircut in the mirror]

[combing on her hair]
I love myself like this.
[Allie follows Hedy into an exotic club, as Hedy pretends to be Allie]
Allie! Hey, Allie - Regular or diet?
Diet!
Something is different.
Yes.
Yes.

[as Allie watches]
Jim, you look like my sister's boyfriend.
[Graham tells Allie that he can hear her and Sam have sex]
Oh, this is a little embarrassing, but... since we're letting our hair down - These old air vents between our apartments carry sound. It's a weird accoustic thing.
Well, what do you hear?
[the two remain quiet before laughing together]

[Allie embarrassed]
Oh, no. Oh, no. Oh, God. I'm so embarrassed.
[Allie sees Hedy's night clothes soaking in a sink of water and blood]

[Hedy connects it to being on her period]
Mine always comes when I'm wearing something nice.
[Hedy and Sam fight after Hedy forces herself on Sam sexually]

[Hedy talks to Sam about her friendship to Allie]
Well, I don't expect you to understand our friendship.

[Sam starts to yell the truth to Hedy]
She cannot fucking stand you for Christ's sake!
That's not true.
Oh, bullshit!
Uh-uh.
You're too needy... You're always clingy... You're constantly in her face.
She needs me. Who was there for her when her boss almost raped her? Hmm?
What?
Who took care of her? You were off on a business trip, or screwing someone.
She never said a word to me about that!
That's right. She told me. So, don't try and make me think that we're not close. We lean on each other, and we... We protect each other. We're... We're best friends.
You're nuts, you know that? Yeah, I think you're out of your skull.

[Hedy gives a little chuckle]
Yeah, well, sticks and stones, okay?
[Hedy finally tells Allie that she murdered Sam]
You know why I think you're sick? You're upset about Sam.

[Hedy puts on a pair of rubber gloves]
You know Sam's dead, don't you? Yeah, we don't have much time.

[Allie cries unable to believe that it's all true]
You... You didn't do it, Hedy, did you? You couldn't have! Oh, Why? Why?
Allie, he came in my mouth, and then he tried to beat the shit out of me because I wanted to tell you. You know... It was an accident. But... He deserved it.
[Hedy tells Allie that she's not going to leave her behind]
Why are you making me do this?

[Hedy pulls back the hammer of a pistol]
We're friends, Allie, and you could be in a lot of trouble without me. But I'm not going to leave you. That wouldn't be right. I won't leave you. Okay, let's go.

[Hedy slaps Allie in the face repeatedly]
Up! Up, up!
[Hedy dyes her hair back to no longer look like the wanted Allison Jones]

[Hedy talks out to Allie in the other room]
Wait till you see me. Your color was beautiful but I can't go around looking like you anymore, can I? Okay now, Allie, don't laugh.

[Hedy jumps around the corner, as Allie remains silent with tape over her mouth]
Ta-da!
[Hedy gets a comment from the check cashier girl about her newest hair color]
What's the part this time?
Excuse me?
You're an actress, right? You're never the same person twice.
Oh.
I like it. I just thought the other was more you.
Well, maybe next time I'll try blonde.
Really? I'm flattered, thanks.
[Hedy walks into the apartment and back-slaps the tied-up Allie across the face]

[Hedy shakes Allie's body and falls to her knees]
How can you do that? Everything I've done, I've done for you. Do you understand that? The people you hated...

[Hedy slaps her hand to her own chest]
I hated. People like you don't care.

[Hedy stands up walking behind Allie, throwing a table to the ground]
Just like that stupid girl in Tampa. She called my parents, too. Told them all my secrets.

[Hedy pulls Allie's head back by her hair]
You want to put me away, huh? I can't... I can't keep making excuses for you, Allie. I can't.

[Hedy begins to lose her breath, repeating herself while walking into the other room]
I can't, I can't, I can't, I can't - Oh, God. Oh, God, oh...
[Allie hears the screams and thrashes Hedy makes in the other room]
[Allie tries talking to Hedy from under the tape over her mouth]

[Hedy walks up behind her holding a knife]
What?

[Hedy then rips the tape off Allie's mouth]
What?

[Allie whispers]
Please.

[Hedy mumbles while deepening the knife into Allie's throat]
No.

[Allie stretches her neck into the knife and kisses Hedy on the lips, whispering]
Don't make me leave you, Ellen.
[Mitch Myerson's business computers begin to lose all of the data of Allie's work]

[Mitch angrily reads from his computer screen]
'The Last Payment in Fulfillment of the Contract between Fontana Fashions and Allison Jones is past due. Please Contact Allison Jones within 24 Hours or the rest of your data will be irretrievably lost. This Payment-Policing Program is installed on all Allison Jones' software.'

[Mitch screams]
Bitch!
[Mitch enters Graham's apartment locking Hedy out in the hallway]

[Mitch sees Allie taped to the floor of the apartment]
What the fuck is going on in here?

[Mitch rips the tape off from Allie's mouth]
Be careful, she's crazy.
[Hedy has Allie type her own suicide letter on the computer, telling her what to write]

[Hedy says to Allie]
'I don't want to try to be loved anymore. I don't want to be scared anymore. Or to kill anymore. I don't want to kill anymore. I... don't want to be alone anymore. I don't want to be anything anymore. I don't need a reason to kill myself. I need a reason not to. There isn't one.' You don't want to say anything special to anyone? Okay, 'Allison Jones.'

[Hedy holds Allie's hand up to place her fingerprints on the computer monitor]
There. Now they'll know it was you.
No one who knows me will believe that I wrote that. I was never that scared. Well... Not like that.
[Hedy talks to Allie for the last time, thinking she's in the closed cabinet]

[Hedy talks from outside the cabinet doors]
Why are you hiding from me?

[Hedy hits the hook into the cabinet]
You think I can't find you? Huh? Your goddamn shirt is sticking out of the door.
[Hedy opens the door, gasping as she hits her hook at a mirror reflection of herself]
[Allie swings down from the ventilation shaft above, stabbing a screw driver into Hedy's back]

[Hedy groans, continuing to try and fight, overpowered by Allie as Allie pulls out and stabs the screwdriver a second time into Hedy's back, as Hedy falls to the ground]
Allie?
